oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Potato virus Y transmitting aphids in a Finnish seed potato area
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Kirchner, S.M.
Hiltunen, L.
Virtanen, E.
Döring, T.F.
Valkonen, J.P.T.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Crop health, quality, protection
oai_dc:dc.dc:description:
The aphid-transmissible Potato virus Y is a major problem in seed potato production (Valkonen , 2007).
The aphid flight activity was monitored from mid-June to the end of August with a suction trap and with yellow pan traps in 2007 and 2008.
Previous studies have concluded that potato colonising aphids are not the main vectors of Potato virus Y.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Kirchner, S.M.; Hiltunen, L.; Virtanen, E.; Döring, T.F. and Valkonen, J.P.T. (2009) Potato virus Y transmitting aphids in a Finnish seed potato area. In: Book of abstracts, p. 167.
